quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: John and Inventor
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, bonannos. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: John is a slang term meaning prostitute.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Chinese eunuch is controversially regarded as the inventor of paper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cai Lun

questions.question: This American engineer is known as the inventor of the microwave oven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percy Spencer

questions.question: Eoin is a version of the name John.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What American scientist invented the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and the long-lasting electric light bulb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Edison

questions.question: What was Joseph Bonannos nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Bananas

questions.question: What is the name of the German scientist who invented the X-ray machine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilhelm Roentgen

questions.question: This NY mobster was nicknamed The Chin and was often seen wandering the streets of Greenwich Village in his bathrobe and slippers, mumbling incoherently to himself.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vincent Gigante

questions.question: Which of the following happened first chronologically?

options.text: The Madeira Islands were discovered in the Atlantic ocean.
Vasco Nunez de Balboa discovered the Pacific Ocean.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Madeira Islands were discovered in the Atlantic ocean.

questions.question: The name John originates from the Hebrew name Yohannan. What does Yohannan mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yahweh is Gracious

questions.question: In 1519, in search of the Spice Islands, Portuguese navigator Ferdinand Magellan set out on an expedition with 241 men on five ships, called Concepción, San Antonio,Trinidad, Victoria and what else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santiago

questions.question: This Italian-American gangster ran the streets of Chicago during the Prohibition years and orchestrated the most notorious gangland killing of the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Capone

questions.question: Did John Loren Sandford write a book titled Dark  of the Moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Carlo Gambinos family belonged to the Honored Society, a criminal brotherhood that used codes of honor and millions of Italian Lira to control illegal businesses in Sicily.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This scientist discovered insulin and called it pancreatine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolae Paulescu

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Nobility and Philologist
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, discovery, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the philologist who invented the Esperanto language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ludwik Lazarz Zamenhof

questions.question: In Belgium, nobility titles are still granted by the King of the Belgians.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How long did Queen Victoria reign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 63 years

questions.question: What is the name of the Italian maker of musical instruments who is considered the inventor of the piano?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bartolomeo Cristofori

questions.question: Which is correctly ranked highest to lowest
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marquess, Earl, Baron, Knight

questions.question: This American physicist invented the first automatic programmable electronic digital computer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Vincent Atanasoff

questions.question: In Korea, a Panseo is a:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Viscount

questions.question: Who is credited with the discovery of penicillin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Fleming

questions.question: The Russian nobility were required to wear a kind of uniform at Court.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The highest ranked title in British Nobility is:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duke

questions.question: In Germany, a Kaiser is a:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emperor

questions.question: What is the name of the man who invented dynamite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Nobel

questions.question: In Fiji the nobility consists of:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chiefs

questions.question: In Chinese nobility, the equivalent of a Count is called:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bo

questions.question: The collective peerage of Japan is known as:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kazoku

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Queen Victoria and Ronald Reagan
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: By what moniker was Queen Victoria known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grandmother of Europe

questions.question: Ronald Reagan was originally a member of the Democratic party.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Slavery was banned in all of the British empire under Queen Victoria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After her husbands death in 1861, Queen Victoria only wore almost entirely black for the remainder of her life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these was Ronald Reagans favorite candy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jelly Beans

questions.question: Queen Victoria was the first monarch to live in Kensington Palace.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where is Queen Victoria buried?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frogmore, Windsor

questions.question: How many lives is Ronald Reagan credited for saving while a life guard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 77

questions.question: How many children did Queen Victoria have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: During World War II Ronald Reagan made training videos for the US Army Air Corps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What other title did Queen Victoria of England have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Empress of India

questions.question: Who was Queen Victorias spouse and consort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Albert

questions.question: Ronald Reagan held many jobs, one of which was in sports. What was this job?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sports caster

questions.question: Who succeeded Queen Victoria on the British throne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Edward VII

questions.question: Queen Victoria died of typhoid fever.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Suicide and Country
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, margarita, terrorists. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which author is not correctly matched with the novel she wrote?

options.text: Margaret Mitchel - Gone with the Wind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Moore - The Blind Assassin

questions.question: This Academy Award-winning actress starred opposite Judy Garland in the 1944 romantic musical film Meet Me in St. Louis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret OBrien

questions.question: Where did Blackbeards famous ship sink?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Coast of the Carolinas

questions.question: What US president had a daughter named Margaret who became a successful writer of fiction and non-fiction books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry S. Truman

questions.question: Name the famous author whose granddaughter committed suicide one day before the anniversary of his own suicide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernest Hemingway

questions.question: The Master and Margarita, which many critics regard as one of the greatest novels of the 20th century, tells the story of a visit by the Devil to a fervently atheistic society. In what country is the novel set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Soviet Union

questions.question: Margaret Rutherford won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for this movie, starring Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The V.I.P.s

questions.question: How long was Blackbeards reign of terror?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 years

questions.question: A former schoolteacher, this actress gained fame for her portrayal of The Wicked Witch of the West in the 1939 film The Wizard of Oz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Hamilton

questions.question: This American cultural anthropologist, who was a featured writer and speaker in the mass media throughout the 1960s and 1970s, was a proponent of broadened sexual mores.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Mead

questions.question: What was the name of the man who shot Ronald Reagan in 1981?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hinckley

questions.question: In which middle eastern country did terrorists attack an American marine barracks during the Ronald Reagan administration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lebanon

questions.question: What was the real first name of the infamous pirate Blackbeard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward

questions.question: What event occurred six days after Marguerite de Valois (Queen Margot) marriage to Henry de Bourbon, the King of Navarre?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Bartholomews Day

questions.question: What war was the UK involved in during Margaret Thatchers tenure as Prime Minister?

options.text: The War in Bosnia and Herzegovina

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Falklands War

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Number and Blackbeard
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, people, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What subjects did Mother Teresa teach, from 1930 to 1948, at St. Marys High School in Calcutta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geography and Catechism

questions.question: What uniform number did baseball player Johnny Bench wear while with the Reds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: Len Dawson, who played quarterback for the KC Chiefs, wore number 16.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Bobby Hull wore number 9 when he played for the NHL team the Chicago Blackhawks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Blackbeard is considered the most successful pirate of all time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year did Blackbeard die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1718

questions.question: After Blackbeard died, he was beheaded and his head was suspended from the ship of his captor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A wreck which was claimed to be Blackbeards ship was discovered near North Carolina in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Mother Teresa was a citizen of the United States of America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What American city did Blackbeard successfully blockade in his most daring and famous act?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlston

questions.question: What number did Billy White Shoes Johnson wear when he played for the Houston Oilers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 84

questions.question: Jerry Rice wore number 82 when he played for the San Francisco 49ers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these players did not wear number 32?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nolan Ryan

questions.question: What number did football quarterback Brian Griese wear while playing for the Chicago Bears (2006-2007)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14

questions.question: What was the uniform number of Carlton Fisk when he played for the Chicago White Sox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 72

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Author and Abortion
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous philosopher and teacher of Alexander the Great said, Happiness depends upon ourselves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle

questions.question: What spiritual leader of his country made the following statement, We must be the change we wish to see in the world.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mohandas Gandhi

questions.question: Name the famous lady who made the following witty remark: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets, the more he is interested in her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agatha Christie

questions.question: What leading author of the Victorian era stated, Friendship is the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person, having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Eliot

questions.question: Tommy Lee from the band Motley Crue was married to this actress before he met Pamela Anderson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heather Locklear

questions.question: Who had previously owned the Bel Air mansion bought by Sir Tom Jones upon moving to the United States in 1974?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dean Martin

questions.question: Why did President Thomas Jefferson prefer writing to public speaking, and gave only two public speeches during his Presidency?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had a speech defect

questions.question: What Irish playwright and author said, I can resist everything except temptation.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: What exponent of the Arts and Crafts movement stated, There is no failure except in not trying.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elbert Hubbard

questions.question: What prolific American author does this quote belong to: Once can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Keller

questions.question: What famous cartoonist said, Just remember when you are over the hill, you begin to pick up speed.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Schulz

questions.question: Which of these words was coined by Sir Thomas More, who is regarded as one of the most influential Renaissance humanist scholars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Utopia

questions.question: What Oscar and Emmy Award winner said, All of our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walt Disney

questions.question: In her Nobel Prize acceptance speech, Mother Teresa declared, Abortion is the worst evil, and the greatest enemy of peace. However, she did admit that in some situations abortion may be necessary, after she learned that more than 450,000 women in East Pakistan (now Bangladesh) had been systematically raped, in the aftermath of the Bangladesh Liberation War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What political leader and noted orator is quoted here: A politician needs the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month, and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didnt happen.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill
